derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French escumoir, from escumer 'skim', from escume 'scum'

means.word_mean: 2. a cooking utensil used to skim fat from the surface of liquids
3. a stiff straw hat with a flat crown
4. gull-like seabird that flies along the surface of the water with an elongated lower mandible immersed to skim out food
